description:
First, with a D5600 in 2017, 31 subs - 4 minutes, not a good focus, not a good collimation.
One year later, same place, always a Newton 200/800 (Lacerta this time vs Skywatcher before), ZWO 1600, motorized focuser, good focus, good collimation but some tilt.
I did the same traitment for the two.
Now it's the end with bad colors balance, I used the photometric calibration of Pixinsight, agreat tool!
And for the fun, comparison with Hubble & Subaru pictures.

I just have a problem with high HA signal: for exemple in the left, you can see a bright bluish nebulosity and think should be red seing the HA layer and Subaru picture.
I use different techniques (NRGB, non linear, linear, pixelmaths, linearfit etc) nothing work, can you help me if I send you data layers?
title: M101 - Comparison digital camera/CMOS/Hubble & Subaru - High definition
